dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits main rivers over muddy substrate, in deep waters with swift current (Ref. 56749).  Feeds on insects and small fishes (Ref. 56749).

dataObjects.title: Bagrichthys hypselopterus
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Bagrichthys hypselopterus." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 10 Mar 2013, 09:01 UTC. 2 Feb 2015 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bagrichthys_hypselopterus&oldid=645286228>.
dataObjects.description:
Bagrichthys hypselopterus is a species of bagrid catfish found in Thailand, Indonesia and Malaysia. This species reaches a length of 40.0 cm and is commercially fished for human consumption.

References[edit]

  • Froese, Rainer and Pauly, Daniel, eds. (2011). "Bagrichthys hypselopterus" in FishBase. December 2011 version.
This Bagridae-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
